intro: Ceropegia ericiflora, commonly known as the woolly ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and hairy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
